revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

div.ab: -- Pharmouthi -, in the city of Oxyrhynchus in the Thebaid. Serapion son of Dionysios, Macedonian, acknowledges to Dionysios son of Dionysios, Thracian, belonging to the manly cavalrists --, in the street, that he has ceded to him in accordance with the administrative arrangements of those controlling cavalry affairs and on the basis of memorandum submitted by Sarapion to Perdikkas, the official in charge of the registries of military settlers' land grants, ten arouras of catoecic land belonging to him near ---ro situated in the Upper toparchy, in the kleros of N.N., of which the neighbors are: on the South a dike, on the North the-- of the kleros, on the East the embankment of the kleros, on the West ---, in order that they belong to Dionysios and his offspring, along with the other rights and benefits, irrefutably for all time, --

listBibl.bibl: Worp, K. A. - Nielsen, B. "New Papyri from the New York University Collection: II". ZPE 136 (2001) 134-6 (Nr. 16)
